data.title: Pit stop
data.text: I had a local draft beer which was okay, but my wife who is not a beer drinker, opted for a Pinot noir red wine which was on tap and was poured at a quarter of the normal amount of a glass of wine. The wine was good and so was the atmosphere.

data.title: Awesome Beer selection!!
data.text: This place has a really good selection of beers.  It doesn't serve food, but the restaurant next door does.  You can have it delivered to you fairly quickly.

data.title: If you like beer, come here
data.text: This place has a wide variety of bottled and on tab beers.   Including alot of craft beers and Belgian Beers.   If you want some good beer, this is the choice in Gainesville.

data.title: Beers
data.text: It's a little pricey here but if you follow them on Instagram, they sometimes have deals going on. They have good beer and friendly service. There's a smoking area outside. Bathrooms are kinda cool. They let people write all over the walls. It's entertaining to read if you're in no rush to exit. Great atmosphere and it's right in the middle of Gainesville.

data.title: Rude Staff
data.text: Walked in at 1:00 and the bartender screamed "LAST CALL" in our faces after ignoring us for 15 minutes. We were the only people in there. Not a good experience.

data.title: A Great Pint
data.text: The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is great. I really like the handles on the walls and all the brewery signs as it add a uniqueness to the place. The beer selection is interesting and diverse. The only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is that most of the beer is regional. Obviously this isn't a terrible thing, but I would have liked to see some beers from other parts of the country and world up there to give the place a more cultured atmosphere. But I can appreciate what they have done and will definitely stop by when I'm looking for a great pint.

data.title: Tons of Options and they allow you to bring your own food.
data.text: I love the choice of beers available at GHOB. I love the fact that I could have wings and pizza delivered from another place and eat it with my beer. They staff is awesome. They know beer well. Specially Dustin. He is the man.

data.title: Good Beer, Weak Menu
data.text: The beer options are TONS of fun! The food menu is weak. Would recommend eating ahead and then enjoying a wonderful beer here!

data.title: Crafty
data.text: A great beer selection from a great business. I like the way the establishment is set up. Comfortable and welcoming. You can never go wrong with a beer selection at this place. They always have something different and unusual.

data.title: how can you get beer wrong
data.text: just ate here and food beer atmosphere was great. lots of different beers which is the best thing espesh the strong beers and we went for trivia night cuz we read bout it on here. the reviews are correct not a 5 star place for us but for food n a few beers after work its ok def recommended

data.title: beer
data.text: a lot of different kinds of beer ! lots of flavors i happen not to like any fruity or strong beer tastes. i am very simple corona will do , but my friends enjoyed it very much . they also have wine too lol i know that because that's what i was drinking that night, there was also trivia game going on , it was fun .

data.title: great beer, not a fancy spot.
data.text: I have had lots of great beer here. I have not had food here and am not sure if they serve it. call ahead to ask... Not a fancy spot, but the variety of beer on tap is amazing !!

data.title: Lots of beer
data.text: This place has a great selection of craft beers.  You cannot order food there, but you can order in from other places and have it delivered there.  Interesting.  If you are looking for many different types of beers, this is the place.

data.title: Very nice place for Gainesville to have
data.text:
Friendly service and very knowledgeable of all of the beers that they sale.

The variety of local ales and beers was amazing.

The bar tender allowed us to try several of the drinks before making the final order.

Its a great place to be with friends and closed ones whilst enjoying a fine local ale or beer.

It would be nice if they had a taste map and perhaps make into a game for single people to match their tastes.

Cheers.

data.title: Too many choices!
data.text: Beer, beer and lots of beer.  High octane, low octane, light, dark, you name it.  Helpful staff and the menu board is handy.  When you park, pay for at least 2 hours on the meter.

data.title: Awesome Beer, Great Atmosphere
data.text: Not a whole lot more I can say that isn't in the title! The beer selection was amazing, especially for such a tiny town. We ordered appetizers which were really creative and delicious. The service was so friendly and the guy really helped us pick out a beer that we would like. Great place!

data.title: There is something for everyone here!
data.text: Love it!  Not much else to say.  My only complaint is that they replaced the menu board with tvs.  It wouldn't be so bad, but the writing keeps scrolling and it's really annoying when you are trying to decide what you want to order.  All of the words changing/scrolling makes you lose where you were.  Other than that, GHOB gets an A+!

data.title: Great beer with friendly service
data.text:
Not a whole lot more I need to say than what's in the title.  But a very cool thing about this place is that you can order from any take-out/delivery place in town and eat it there.  I got a pizza last time and the bartender even provided some plates and napkins for us.
They also have several TVs and have most of the Sports packages available.
Check out their 'tap takeovers' they have on Tuesdays - get good beer and some swag to go with it.

data.title: This place makes my beer loving husband very happy.
data.text: My husband likes trying different draft beers so he had to go to this place.  Super nice employees James and Dustin gave him samplers on 2 different days which thrilled him.  James had one TV tuned into the "Top Gear" show which also thrilled my husband as he loves sport cars.  I was happy as the House of Beer has bar stools with backs as I knew I would be held hostage there by my hubbie for a while.  Try this place out if you are a beer lover as the employees really know their beers plus are very intelligent conversationalists. Oh and I had cider one day and wine the next so other drinks available as well.

data.title: Well-stocked addition to Gainesville's Burgeoning Craft Beer Scene
data.text: This is a bar, not a restaurant - no food. As a craft beer enthusiast, I had been waiting for the opening of Gainesville House of Beer for months (you can follow them on Twitter and Facebook). When we visited in September, they had only been open a few weeks. While the decor leaves something to be desired (as in, there IS NO decor, save a couple beer signs and flat screen TVs), you're not really there for the ambience, are you? No, you're there for the beer, and they've got plenty of it. Mostly draft, they rotate kegs very often, meaning there will be something new to try every time you visit. The selection has great variation - lagers, a couple stouts, some pumpkin beers (so tasty), and styles of beer of which many people have a only a passing knowledge. The service was super-friendly, and they seem to make an effort to show their appreciation for customers. They have a Rail Club, where after drinking several styles of beer (and marking it on a card they give you), you can get free drafts and other goodies. Hmm, trying to think of a critique... I was surprised by the carpet - you wouldn't think that would be a good idea in a bar, and it's very institutional-looking. But that won't stop me from returning, and often!
